I have a problem related to my gig. 1st two months was going fine. I was enjoying doing work in fiverr. But from past two weeks I am facing this problem. Whenever I create new gig I put accurate information and when i click on “PUBLISH GIG” button it redirects to the “Pricing” area page. Because of which I am unable to create any new gig from past few weeks. Has anyone faced this problem? Your help and suggestion will be highly appreciated. Thankyou!
reply_text:
I sent a customer support request on this yesterday. Still waiting to hear back but it seems like this has been an ongoing bug since at least May 2016, possibly earlier. I’m amazed after all this time a bug like this hasn’t been fixed yet. I’m new to Fiverr but to me it just seems really concerning that a bug like this has been around this long without a fix. Makes me wonder if this platform is going to be reliable to do business on.
EDIT: Customer support contacted me back about this. The issue was because I didn’t have a phone number listed on my account and my account needed to be verified with the phone number. Anyone else having this issue, try going to your settings and verifying your phone number and see if the issue persists. It worked for me. Funny though how there was no error message or anything stating that needed to be done in order to publish my gig. I was able to publish two other gigs previously without the issue. Anyways…

thread_name: Deep fake voice reconstruction-reusing someone’s voice, without consent
thread_text:
There have been multiple threads about reselling being permitted here. My suggestion is adding in terms of service that deep fake voice construction (reusing someone’s voice) without their consent is not permitted.
It is one thing to record your voice, be paid for a recording and waive your rights to that recording.
It is another to record, be paid for that and for your voice to be reused for different narration and context without your knowledge or consent ad infinitum without compensation.
A reseller on this site has, among the voice samples available, voice samples that are artificial/slightly robotic sounding. One of the offered services for that reseller was text to voice.
If the buyer request clearly indicates that the seller’s voice can be reused for a different script in the future without additional payment or consent, fine.
But I think it should be in the terms of service that doing so without consent is disallowed.
Also, if a seller offers a text-to-voice gig, the original narrator’s consent to this should be verifiable.
I’m not saying it would be an easy task for Fiverr to investigate this!
reply_text: Are you sure they are using a specific person’s voice without their permission though? Text to speech software that allows commercial use does exist. One example would be google. As far as I know they allow using their text to speech commercially and they have a pretty nice library of voices.

reply_text:
Well, in that case I think presumption of innoscence should apply and investigation should only occur if the owner of the rights to specific voice complains about it. It would be very inefficient to check every delivery of every order, especially since there can be hours upon hours of audio.
Although I do understand where your concern is coming from, some of the gigs of that sort can be a bit shady if not downright fraudulent.

thread_name: Deep fake voice reconstruction-reusing someone’s voice, without consent
thread_text:
There have been multiple threads about reselling being permitted here. My suggestion is adding in terms of service that deep fake voice construction (reusing someone’s voice) without their consent is not permitted.
It is one thing to record your voice, be paid for a recording and waive your rights to that recording.
It is another to record, be paid for that and for your voice to be reused for different narration and context without your knowledge or consent ad infinitum without compensation.
A reseller on this site has, among the voice samples available, voice samples that are artificial/slightly robotic sounding. One of the offered services for that reseller was text to voice.
If the buyer request clearly indicates that the seller’s voice can be reused for a different script in the future without additional payment or consent, fine.
But I think it should be in the terms of service that doing so without consent is disallowed.
Also, if a seller offers a text-to-voice gig, the original narrator’s consent to this should be verifiable.
I’m not saying it would be an easy task for Fiverr to investigate this!
reply_text:
Deepfake is against the rules for video. I don’t think it mentions audio and I’m not sure that would be necessarily be called deep fake for audio only. So I don’t think currently it’s against the TOS/site rules to use someone’s audio that they bought for another video/videos if they bought the necessary rights (eg. commercial rights).
See:
https://www.fiverr.com/community/standards/integrity-authenticity
Deepfakes are created using artificial intelligence technology that superimposes the movements and words of one person onto another. While there are many legitimate applications of this technology, including mainstream filmmaking, deepfakes can also make it harder to combat the spread of disinformation and potentially easier to dismiss real events as fake. We monitor deepfake activity closely and will review reported cases on an individual basis.
Also say someone got the right audio from seller x and could use that for new voice overs, I don’t think they’d be pretending to be seller x (they probably don’t even say who it is) - so it’s not exactly faking seller x I think.

thread_name: “Ranked sellers trouble” - we all on the bottom at search result. No orders - no money?
thread_text:
I noticed that from August 1, 2020, the flow of questions and orders from new customers has stopped.
Absolutely.
Instead of 5-6 new customers every day there is just zero now.
I looked for my gigs and found them all at the very bottom of the search results.
Five star Gig with hundreds of reviews lies below absolute beginners and low-rated gigs.
From first line to last page for one day!
Besides myself, I saw on the last page of all my fellow competitors of the 2nd level.
How do you like that, friends?
Support politely advised to read the forum.
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
This is the first time I’ve seen this in 2 years.
Who what thinks about this?
It will be black August…
reply_text:
The situation you are speaking of is normal on Fiverr. Your placement is all part of the secret Fiverr algorithm. I was getting several orders per day, and now I too am going through a dry spell due to my gigs’ placement.
There are only 48 first page positions for gigs, and not all of the gigs on Fiverr can appear there. Fiverr also boosts new sellers by letting them appear on the first pages for a short time.
There is not much you can do about the situation. I use the time to improve my gigs and relax, knowing my time to be in a better search placement will return.
vadikne:
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
Fiverr is not dependent on each of us as sellers as there are tens of thousands of sellers on Fiverr.

Does buyers want to buy gig from new sellers especially with fake reviews? Thats the real question.
I think most buyers are knowledgeable enough to figure out if reviews are fake. I am a seller and a buyer on Fiverr. I read not only the reviews of the seller, but I look at the buyer’s profile. If the buyer has reviews from the seller, then I know the reviews are more than likely fake.
Also, many buyers and sellers with questionable accounts and claim to be US citizens will soon be losing their accounts due to Fiverr’s new requirement that they prove they are US citizens by submitting a W9 tax form with their Social Security number on it. Good riddance to such fake accounts and their fake reviews.

thread_name: “Ranked sellers trouble” - we all on the bottom at search result. No orders - no money?
thread_text:
I noticed that from August 1, 2020, the flow of questions and orders from new customers has stopped.
Absolutely.
Instead of 5-6 new customers every day there is just zero now.
I looked for my gigs and found them all at the very bottom of the search results.
Five star Gig with hundreds of reviews lies below absolute beginners and low-rated gigs.
From first line to last page for one day!
Besides myself, I saw on the last page of all my fellow competitors of the 2nd level.
How do you like that, friends?
Support politely advised to read the forum.
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
This is the first time I’ve seen this in 2 years.
Who what thinks about this?
It will be black August…
reply_text:
hrizvi2000:
I think fiverr algo boosts gigs with recent reviews.
If that were the case I wouldn’t also be facing a slump in sales.
Public reviews are not as “important” factors to the algorithm anymore.
They used to be, but not anymore.
Aside from negative reviews, anything over 3.0 stars is pretty much useless to the algo.
The number of sellers sporting a 4.9+ average nowadays is insane.
So the algorithm has been adjusted.
Did you know that it’s partly why the “secret reviews” were introduced?
Those are much more important to how you rank.

reply_text:
Unfortunately, Fiverr’s algo does seem to try and spread the love so that people who are beginners or level 1 get a bite of the cherry. I suppose it’s their way of getting the cream to float to the top. Because what, in theory, should be happening is that we get lots of regular customers which means we’re not so dependent on the search results.
However, I know I’ve been through fallow periods too. At first I panicked, and changed lots of things in my gig - profile description, gig description, tags. You name it and I definitely changed it. I had a very slack period before Christmas - horrible - and I had to tighten my belt. Then things changed and got better in January. So, what I’d say is that just tickle your gigs, maybe polish them a bit, get your friendly local proofreader (me) to check them for you and make sure your images are professional and your tags are likely to work. Then wait…

You’re going to fluctuate. That’s how marketplaces work.
Your not ranking where you want to be and getting the success you did before doesn’t indicate a problem. It’s literally just how commerce works.
Focus on creating a sustainable business instead of relying on ranking well in a subcategory and then being mad at Fiverr when you don’t get that.
No successful business relies on factors it can’t control. What research have you done on your competition here?

thread_name: Allow creating custom offers with correct conversion to other currencies?
thread_text: I’m quite new here, so maybe I’m overlooking something, but when I have my site set to €, prices to my gigs are indeed shown in €, but I can only create custom offers in Dollar (this forum doesn’t render standalone dollar signs?), which is awkward, when I have agreed on a price in € with a client and then have to convert it. What’s worse is that the conversion fiverr uses to display the custom offer to the client is… wrong? For example, I agree with my client on 45€, so I Google to convert that to Dollar, currently: 53,34$. So I create an offer with 54$, but the client sees it as 48€ for some reason. So I retract the offer and create a new one with 53$ and the client receives and offer of 47€. I don’t understand where that number is coming from, but either way, fiverr should allow me to choose the currency for each offer or at least always use the one I have selected as default - and of course the conversion needs fixing, unless I’m overlooking something.
reply_text:
You’ve misinterpreted.
You can only bill in US dollars and Fiverr only allows you to pay in US.
The currency you’re seeing is only US dollars converted into whatever the other currency is. You’re just seeing a conversion, not billing in a different currency.
Fiverr does let you convert the fees into your currency before you withdraw, but that’s all.
We can’t choose what currency to bill someone in. No marketplace would operate that way because they’d lose money. It’s always USD.
Please read the ToS.

reply_text: Hi, I understand that, and maybe I didn’t express myself properly. Certainly, the offer will always be in USD, however what I am saying is that a) if there is a conversion option on the site, even if it is just visual, then it should apply to all USD values, even in the offer creation view, so for example I can choose to enter a euro amount, and then it would show me the USD value it will convert it to, because, if the customer also has their account set to euro, they will also see the price of that offer in euro (even if the actual internal value is still USD). And b) any website that offers a visual conversion needs to make sure it’s correct, because based on my actual example, it isn’t. Maybe there is just an internal conversion rate that needs to be contiuously updated?

It tells you the solution/what will happen: “You’ll get your data soon”. If you could get it earlier, they wouldn’t say that. This isn’t a problem. It’s only a problem because you’re impatient and want to rush them.
It says they’re “back” because there was an analytics bug for a long time.

Your Fiverr Experience

First, download Grammarly keyboard from play store on your mobile (it is also available for iPhone users) (Clear all data, cookies and browser history of your chrome) Then, go to chrome web browser (incognito mode) on mobile (only on mobile). Use the desktop version. Log in to your…
Hope this can solve your problem!

thread_name: Earnings amount for job is INCORRECT
thread_text:
My earnings for a $90 job should be $72. In my pending earnings, fiverr shows that I will only earn $60. I have not received a reply from Customer support regarding this matter even though it’s been over 48 hours since I submitted a ticket. I have 3 other orders that will be completed within the next couple weeks and this had better be resolved before those jobs are complete. Fiverr has always charged 20% commission, so how could the algorithms possible calculate my earning incorrectly? The terms of service page says that sellers earn 80%, so there is no excuse for this type of error on Fiverr’s part. I will raise holy hell if this is not corrected and if this were to happen again. I will also report them to every possible fraud and government agency. This is unacceptable.
MOD NOTE screenshot removed,the username of your buyer was visible
reply_text:
This is a long shot but did you happen to mess with the currency option?
$72 translates into 60 euros.

thread_name: My response time has enlarged despite me replying to clients on time and even taking orders
thread_text: My response time has been increasing. It’s now at 115 hours. I don’t understand the problem. I have even taken some orders and delivered on time. It has been getting worse every day.
reply_text:
I think the best explanation is here:
Understanding Response Time & Response Rate
Responsiveness refers to the tracking of a Fiverr seller’s response rate (what percentage of inbox messages you reply to within twenty four hours) as well as your response time (how quickly you respond to a new request in your inbox). Replying within 24 hours is necessary for your response to be tracked. Response time is based on the last 60 days of a seller’s activity and tracks the amount of time it takes for a seller to respond when first contacted by a user.
Inbox messages and orders are different topic.

thread_name: My response time has enlarged despite me replying to clients on time and even taking orders
thread_text: My response time has been increasing. It’s now at 115 hours. I don’t understand the problem. I have even taken some orders and delivered on time. It has been getting worse every day.
reply_text:
I think this is one for customer support.
You probably already know this, but it might be useful for others in future to read this…
… your response rate is based on how quickly you respond to each first message from a new potential buyer. It doesn’t matter about the second, third message, etc from each buyer - but you do have to respond to the first message within 24 hours.

thread_name: My response time has enlarged despite me replying to clients on time and even taking orders
thread_text: My response time has been increasing. It’s now at 115 hours. I don’t understand the problem. I have even taken some orders and delivered on time. It has been getting worse every day.
reply_text:
I agree. If if the response time is wrong (eg. if you responded to every first message in the last 60 days within 24 hours, or you are sure the average isn’t >4 days) CS would be able to fix it if it’s wrong if you contact them about it.
Though really if some are wrong (I think someone else said on the forum their response time was a lot of days and CS fixed it), surely Fiverr could run a fix on all the response times and fix any bug. If running the fix on all would take too long, maybe at least those that have a response time >= a day.

thread_name: How do I send my large file to my buyer?
thread_text: Can I use Google Drive?
reply_text:
It would be easier to deliver a zipped folder.
As far as I know, delivering with a google drive link is fine. You could also use WeTransfer - if you set it to email yourself, you can copy the download link it gives you and send that to the buyer.

the_mad_duck:

Regardless, every Us citizen must fill out the W9. Please read this notice by Fiverr. The first FAQ explains it.
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/w-9-collection
the_mad_duck:
Will my gigs be locked if I don’t complete it,
This is what the thread said
W-9 US Verification Requirement
Please note that all sellers are required to check if they need to fill out a Form W-9, regardless of their place of residence. By not doing so, within 30 days, your Gigs will be subject to automatic deactivation.
the_mad_duck:
even though I don’t make enough to matter?
It does not matter if you do not make $20,000. The W9 must be filled out. Fiverr will send 1099 to the relevant tax authority only if you make $20,000.
W-9 US Verification Requirement
When Fiverr is required under applicable laws, it will send a 1099 form at the end of the year to the applicable tax authorities. Currently, this applies to US-based sellers who earned at least $20,000 in that year and had at least 200 separate orders.
the_mad_duck:
Check if you need to fill out Form W-9 to keep your Gigs active.
The only users who do not need to do this are non-US citizens.

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text: yes. right point …

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
How would it help? Buyers will either reply to you, or not; knowing whether they’ve seen your message won’t change that.
Also, what if you see a message, but can’t respond to it quickly, and the buyer is impatient? Do you want them to get angry at you because they know you saw the message?

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
You got exact point,
buyer or seller will benefited by this,
Because we will able to know is he/she declining messages or not seen yet.
Also it’s help us to be patience until my buyer or seller Shaw messages,
and I haven’t send one after.

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
himel19:
Because we will able to know is he/she declining messages or not seen yet.
Fiverr is not set up for sellers to “decline messages” that they don’t want to respond to. In fact, quite the opposite – sellers have 24 hours to respond to any messages that they receive, before not responding starts to penalize their response stat.
Be patient. People will respond to messages as soon as they are able.

thread_text:
I am a newbie when it comes to a freelancing job and on this site also. I want to earn money, especially at this time of the pandemic. I took the exam but this happened after I click the end of the test button. Is this often occur or not?
I hope you could address this. Thank you
reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiver forums.
Sadly, we on the forums are only buyers and sellers like you and cannot address this. You will need to wait to retake the test.
Known issues with the Skill Tests provided by ExpertRating
Fiverr Site Suggestions
Continuing discussions from Take a Test, Earn Trust! and My first impression of the Skills Test feature What are Skill Tests and what do they do? If you’ve explored the options on your profile, you may have found the Skill Tests. These currently have no active benefit to Sellers unless a Buyer specifically looks for them. Relevant results cannot be placed in gigs and they can only be seen in the Seller’s profile. Who is ExpertRating? ExpertRating is considered a course provider and certifica…

thread_name: Buyer paid the whole milestone, But still take him to payment page after ACCEPTING AND CONTINUE for second milestone delivery
thread_text:
This is my first time using the milestone payment system. The order was $325 Buyer paid and start the order. I put 3 milestones. First one $25, Second $200 and Third $100. The first was completed successfully. After delivering the second milestone when the buyer wants to accept the delivery Fiverr take him to the payment page (see the picture)
Please I need help. I hope i will get a proper solution.
Thank you.
reply_text:

Buyer paid for whole order, not just the first milestone, and now it want him to pay again?

The buyer will have to reach out to Customer Support from their end, then, if that’s actually the problem (I’ll admit, with the lack of proof that they paid for the whole order, I have a little red flag going up, wondering if the buyer is trying to get the work for less, or for free). If you want to reach out to support at the same time, and express concern for the buyer’s situation, go for it.
Fair warning, CS is very behind right now, an taking upwards of 10 days to get to tickets.

thread_name: English Test result not shown on profile
thread_text:
Hi there…
I’ve completed fiverr English test and passed with a score of 7.5. I remember after passing i ticked the option that the score will be shown on my Profile. But the problem is now that When i turn on the “Preview Public Mode” from desktop the test score is not showing on my profile. Can anyone help me with this??
Thanks in Advance
reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiverr forums.
This is a known bug.
Known issues with the Skill Tests provided by ExpertRating
Fiverr Site Suggestions
New bug: title of test missing from display. [image] There have also been reports lately of required tests, taken and passed, that are still stated as ‘need to take’ within a gig itself. (Try clearing cookies/cache, try a different browser, try waiting 24-48 hours, and if the problem persists contact Customer Support.)

reply_text:
Great ! Thanks for write.
Great article, sadly it doesn’t answer the question. It is the first time that in 5 years I see that something is not working. At least in my case I don’t see the Gig views. There is no way of knowing whether or not that change in the algorithm is beneficial. Even changing and editing the Gigs, nobody is going to check if their Gigs are really being shown.
Generally that is what I do, when I see that nobody writes me I take actions, I create new Gigs, I try to lower prices, make offers. But this time how can you know?
I think it takes more than just a great 5 page post.
They need to solve the problem or maybe they have to tell us that things are like this now.!
Just as the “clearance times” at all levels changed one day, just as they placed a very complex penalty system based on various variables, perhaps now the idea is that we must be blind and trust as the red notice says "We are doing things as always only that at the moment they are not seen "

Generally that is what I do, when I see that nobody writes me I take actions, I create new Gigs, I try to lower prices, make offers.
What’s stopping you from doing that now?
I know you think you are flying blind without your analytics, but if we are being honest the gig analytics were not tellings us that much.
If you are an experienced seller you can tell when things are going well or if there’s something up.
There is definitely something up, but we don’t know what and Fiverr will not tell us.
That’s a given. What do you do with the cards you’ve been dealt?
Most sellers are considering trying new stuff but we suddenly realize that we are not 100% sure of what works now or that we even know what we did back then that worked so well.

reply_text:
I’m not sure how specific can I be, my head is on fire right now. But:
I get 2* on Jun 2. My first negative review. (I have an old 1* but tend not to count it because it’s for that order auto-completing). It’s a funny story for another time. The order is Fiverr’s Choice.
On Jun 3 I receive 2 orders back to back from new people of my other gig that no one ever buys. It’s very interesting because I haven’t gotten multiple orders from new people on the same day ever since Covid happened.
I complete those, get 5* for both. My main gig is dead.
On Jun 4 the buyer who left me a negative review comes to my inbox and tries to force me to remove the response I’ve left to their review. I report the threat and contact CS. CS tells me there is no case, he had a right to leave a review, I had a right to respond.
On Jun 5 I get another Fiverr’s Choice order on my main gig, finish that one with 5*. The person buys another 3 designs as a custom package. This new custom offer is also marked as Fiverr’s choice. I complete it with 5*.
It’s been a deluge ever since. I got to my entire May earnings around June 12th.
I should mention that my regulars start coming back in June and they mostly order bigger custom packages. Well, bigger for me. My basic price is $50. They mostly buy $150-200 custom offers.
I also get a few new returning customers. We start with a basic package, they later come back to get another 3-4. If that has anything to do with, well, anything.
My delivery time was 3 days during quarantine, I had to switch it back to 4 days in June. Doesn’t seem to affect anything. I usually deliver 12-24 hours before the deadline.
May was terrible. I hit my “comfortable minimum” but barely. Had a few unpleasant interactions with buyers. I worked for that “comfortable minimum” hard.
No cancellations since Apr 1. Then I had the same custom offer canceled twice because the buyer couldn’t sort out their payment method. It led to $700 of canceled funds (my absolute record) handing over my head till Jun 1. CS assured me it wouldn’t affect anything but who knows.

reply_text:
The only way this pay per click on fiverr will work is if it really does work well for sellers, who gain substantial profits from it, so they need to tailor the placements of gigs using it for maximum exposure.
This would be a huge change requiring careful testing, so it makes sense to me to shut down all analytics data while this is going on. I can understand that. I could also understand if the arrangements of gigs in the rankings is temporarily affected by such a test.
It would involve changing how the algorithm is working.
My guess is that it’s only affecting certain categories.

reply_text:
My feeling is that Fiverr’s approach was to attempt to just slip the extra layer (paid ads) into the existing algorithm … resulting in the whole thing falling apart.
Add that to the tsunami of new sellers … major nightmare, from their point of view.
If that’s so, they’re having to write the thing from scratch, test it, roll back to a previous version … rinse, repeat …
And that’s why we don’t see the impressions etc - they’re changing the active algorithm too often for any of that to make any sense at all …

reply_text:
coerdelion:
My feeling is that Fiverr’s approach was to attempt to just slip the extra layer (paid ads) into the existing algorithm … resulting in the whole thing falling apart.
I think they have always hand selected the top two rows at least, or been able to insert a few into those rows by hand instead of by algorithm.
I don’t think it fell apart. I think they may have altered it or changed what parameters it favors among gigs.
I think it was set to artificially boost some gigs and hold down other gigs that could have actually done better if things were left to rank gigs organically, so sellers could get orders even if they were less deserving for various reasons.
I think they took that set of parameters off in the last two months.
And by doing this, they can see what gigs are actually performing the best and which perform the worst, without any type of manipulations.

reply_text:
Hi Frank
It is very important to look at the views, because generally when I was already finishing the work with the active orders I typically saw that Fiverr increased the impressions of my most successful Gigs.
When the up arrows indicated that views were increasing, customers would start writing to you. (this has been going on for 5 years).
Am i paranoid I like conspiracy theories?
It’s possible…
Maybe the problem is that I spend 15 years of my life developing applications for the cloud computing. (I’m system engineer)
One of the basic things according to ITIL best practices is the attention to breakdowns.
When a change is made in an active platform with millions of users there is always a plan to return in case it fails, there are data backups, there is always a contingency plan.
It is impossible that something as expensive as Fiverr has 1 month down.
Sorry but beleive , What happens here is NOT a bug.
Something they are trying, it is probably the promotions (but I do not know).
They may have decided that people who don’t pay won’t get any promotions. Maybe they stop charging us 20% and return our money in less time. Maybe things changed. Maybe they are testing our reaction.
It is also possible that they have decided to change the entire model and they do not care what we think.
In a pandemic, confined, many people looking for money and supplies in many countries and Fiverr “fallen”?
They have to explain something to us …

carlosrada1:
But they get 20% of each sale!! Fiverr is your parther!!
Partners don’t demote people making $1,500 to $2,000 a month, or more.

reply_text:
tech_treon:
Please can you explain me a bit about fiverr’s choice, I mean are sellers selected for it or gigs? and when someone places an order, does fiverr see that this order is a bit interesting and mark the order as fiverr’s choice before you delivering it or it works the other way?
Hi, I know didn’t ask me, but I think no one answered. Fiverr’s Choice is given to the gig, not the seller. Some people believe it’s manually chosen, but I think it’s the algorithm and it has to do with maintaining 5 stars and probably has a lot to do with the secret reviews as well.
I’ve been Fiverr’s Choice almost continuously since March but only a few of my orders say they are “Fiverr’s Choice orders”. I think it’s because the badge doesn’t show with every keyword, so the ones that say they are, it just means that particular buyer chose me after seeing the badge.
But this is just a theory, because once I asked CS and they talked about something else…

fastcopywriter:
The 20% doesn’t bother me, I would gladly pay 30%, even 50%, if I could make $19,000 like I did in 2015. If Fiverr wanted me to raise prices, rewarded me for doing so, if they told me what gigs to create, delete, etc. If they gave me gig images. Then I would have a partner.
This is the point! I agree 100% with you.
If we are going to make money like in 2015 or more, let’s go now!
The problem is that most of them are not receiving messages, clicks, orders.
Most of us are seeing the Fiverr blackout.

The fact is that everything is turned off.

But, since it is a Platform with millions of users, it is very dangerous to remove sellers from the ecosystem. Because the quality falls and on the Internet the availability time is everything!
Many buyers do not now get most of the sellers we have been working for 5 or more years here!
That is a reality!
Maybe not for you, you are selling I know. But it is for the rest!

reply_text: Yes. Something as simple as that, not delivering more than 90% of the orders on time or a slow reply rate can easily remove your top rated seller badge. So… you can lose it as fast as you got it. And it doesn’t matter if you had it for years or not, a single bad month (or 2 months since it’s covering 60 days) can remove all the hard work you did for years to keep the TRS status.

It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.

abednasser581:
in my opinion that is a new policy may be to encourage and motivate the seller to feel using a gig ad in Fiverr is very important.
I feel I’m using Fiverr as a pay gate or such as Shopify (I put and design my services only and I do marketing ).
Sure!
I have been researching other platforms and Fiverr is the only one with that business model. In Fiverr anyone could enter, in the others it is not so easy, even most of them have to pay. Some even investigate and protect their sellers with messages like “I’m sorry but I have many sellers just like you.”
So I think it is possible that Fiverr is changing the business model. They must be trying something and we will soon see that everything is different. I don’t think a one month failure is the cause. There is something else …

The question is: Why do they see clients and we don’t?

I have been on Fiverr for more than 5 years, I am really worried because from the “BUG of GIG views” I have not received any messages or orders.
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?
reply_text:
Okay, since this issue started I have not received any Order .
My Order Completion rate was 92%
But I don’t know Fiverr Yesterday decreased it to 90% ,
I don’t know why they decreased it .

That way they remove your levels and it takes months to recover from a single error …

reply_text:
carlosrada1:
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
First of all, this is NOT Fiverr’s job.
Fiverr is nothing but a marketplace, and the amount of work you get is by far most influenced by supply and demand. If you do a good job, and your clients are happy, you move up in the world and get more orders. There are different other factors, for example, if you are doing this full time or just as a side thing, also it is important to be online, as many customers want a fast/instant reply, etc.
The gig stat “issue” has no relevance, it is just metrics that they show you.
Personally I am getting the same number of daily requests I have always had.
I see that you are musician, as such I am sure you are very well aware of the impact COVID19 has had on the music industry, it is simply not something essential for most companies, and if no money is coming in it will quickly go very far down on the companies list of priorities.
I am sure things will start looking up for you soon.
I wish you good luck and all the best!

Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?
reply_text:
patrickcharlie:
First of all, this is NOT Fiverr’s job.
Hi Patrick, Thanks for write! COngratulations you are the second person who have no problem at all here, of course I know this post is too long now. So , it’s difficult to read…
Patrick lot off sellers on Fiverr have been experiencing a blackout.
During the entire pandemic I was full of work here. Suddenly everything stopped. No messages, no orders and I left the search lists.
The first thing I thought was that it was my problem! Quickly searching the forum I understood that it was not just me, there were other sellers with the problem.
What happens to the vast majority?
Having the best possible level, fulfilling everything on time and with 5-star evaluations took us out of the game.
Patrick, there are people here who have written indicating that they are Top Rated, they received 50 orders on average and today they have nothing.
Friend something is wrong with Fiverr.
It is evident that if I am 5 years old in this I already understood what I must do to go up in the lists, but the case of the Top Rated who have large incomes is even clearer that this sudden blackout is not normal.
Fiverr is making changes to its platform to introduce a new scheme with paid ads. Many say the forum that they have decided to “move” things especially with classic vendors that have Gigs for years producing…
This new method with ads is already in the testing stage for very few users. That’s not the problem!! The problem is that most of us were removed from the search lists.
patrickcharlie:
Fiverr is nothing but a marketplace, and the amount of work you get is by far most influenced by supply and demand.
In this you are right! Let me explain now how that “supply - demand” works on Fiverr.
A buyer searches Fiverr for a service.
Fiverr shows him a list of sellers. That has been changing over the years. Now Fiverr Pro users appear at the top (which makes total sense) and then users with rankings appear and the list turns pages to leave those less relevant at the end.
Fiverr exposes your Gig to its community, for this reason it takes away 20% of your income and also retains your money for 14 days.
That is Fiverr’s job. and they must show you that they are exposing you in exchange for that 20%, that you will receive if you have done things well and on time.
Of course it is supply and demand, but Fiverr by exposing you is telling buyers “Look at the work of this seller” “It is reliable” “It is fast” “Hundreds of users have made positive reviews”
The relation “Supply - demand” is not magic, Fiverr shows the work and the buyers choose.
That has now lost its meaning! Just read yourself to great sellers here who are experiencing the same so that you understand what you may face …
Thank you for your words and I hope that everything continues well.
Fiverr is a platform and we are understanding as a community what happens here? As soon as we understand it, maybe we can adapt or maybe not!
I also hope that Fiverr returns to be a great platform. Only they have that business model maybe they are changing it

reply_text:
I would not advertise as being “the cheapest”, that is never a good idea when selling services (for physical products there is a difference). Personally when I doubled my prices at one point within 2 months I have had more orders than before, and made a lot more revenue, the cheaper you are the worse your clients get, you get resellers, you get guys who will complain no matter how good you are, because they want a discount, etc.
Also a message to all people who are facing issues, how is your industry doing outside of fiverr? That is something you should keep track of, COVID did not impact all industries the same and not all of them at the same time, some industries are yet to feel the aftermath of COVID, some were hit in the beginning and so on.
So make sure, that you on your side have done absolutely EVERYTHING you can before jumping to conclusions.
I noticed many sellers have some idea about what is important in their industry, but they simply do not know how business in general works - and that is perfectly fine, just find someone to help you out, to coach you, train you or simply consult you.
Best of luck and lots of success to all of you guys, keep your heads up!

It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?
reply_text:
That is how you get tricked in to undermining yourself, your colleagues and the industry.
If you work professionally, and if you are really good at what you do, the price is a secondary thing. I am one of the most expensive translators for my language pair, I charge 20x more than the cheapest guy in my category. YOU need to value your work. As I said before when you are too cheap you attract these clients that will ask for even lower prices.

reply_text:
I’ve had long term clients who shop around and tell me that sellers immediately come way down on their prices as an attempt to get them to make a purchase.
And their prices aren’t high to begin with, such as $25 and they come down to $10 without even waiting to see if the person would purchase it for $25. Sellers are entitled to do whatever they want price-wise. But it’s not the best way to establish yourself as a professional.

patrickcharlie:
YOU need to value your work
Great Patrick.!
The main idea here is win - win. I agree 100% with you!
If your service is good, it must have a cost, of course it is a market, but that price war on services is pointless.
Doing a service for 5USD so that you have 4USD that is also subject to approval and they give you 14 days later it does not make sense.
Another problem is if Fiverr offers people such low-cost services, are they really quality?
In my case it became impossible to lower prices further.

reply_text:
sarikaverma007:
reduce my prices
Sarika is good to ask yourself this question. Can you keep those ridiculously low prices going forward? If you offer the customer something for 50 and end up doing it for 10, don’t you think he thought you wanted to steal it?
I have years at Fiverr and the truth is that the best jobs and the best experiences are when the client values your effort and you receive what is fair for your work.
Once I accepted a great job because there were many services ( they were many). In the end I couldn’t finish that job well, since the same person who asked to lower prices, as soon as we started began to behave as if he had paid the higher price. I’m talking about something worth maybe 100 leaving it at 30. It was a terrible experience and when I delivered the disputes began. They asked me for changes that were out of budget. They also asked for things that had settled in again.
I understood that it would never end, and the cancellation led me to lose the level and drop a lot in sales also at that time.
It is better to charge fair because you can spend more than you receive. That makes no sense!

reply_text:
No one said there’s a new “Fiverr policy”.
We are all experiencing pretty much the same thing to a different degree.
We are all assuming what may be happening, but no one knows for sure.
My assumption was that there was a significant change to how the algorithm responds and how fast it moves.
I also theorized that the Covid-19 pandemic definitely acted as an accelerator, with all the new accounts being created and with buyers changing how much they are willing to spend on certain things.
But while we are all in the dark, it’s pretty clear this is not a new policy.
We are experiencing a weird shift in the marketplace and we are exchanging insights and experiences.

I have been on Fiverr for more than 5 years, I am really worried because from the “BUG of GIG views” I have not received any messages or orders.
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?

reply_text:
nguyenkt08:
I can’t see carlosrada1’s gigs, did his account been deleted?
Hi there!
Thanks for writing here!
Here you have my profile
https://www.fiverr.com/carlosrada?up_rollout=true 3
I’ve been on Fiverr by 5 years, as you can see all my Gig appear to be “active”. Saddly many sellers have the same problem, I think you have it now!
Nobody nows exactly the reason of this wear shift. Some seller have this problem like 2-3 months.
At first we thought it was a BUG because the views are not seen but I think this is the new Fiverr normal.
Other sellers have said in this long post that it is the new “paid advertising” scheme. We understand that a few sellers are testing it and that it will be operational soon.
It is evident that advertising will change the position of the sellers in the search lists, and it is possible that this current situation is the first step towards it.
I sincerely believe that the Fiverr business model will change, this is the only platform that operates in this way. They already included the famous “paid certification courses” and only “paid advertising” was missing for Fiverr to become something very similar to its well-known competition …
I think that those of us who have been working here for years must adapt, some sellers suggest having several different work options on other platforms or increasing the presence of your personal brand to make your customer portfolio.
I will always thank Fiverr for giving me the opportunity to make music for more than 25 countries on 5 continents.
We will be back? I do not know…
Do Fiverr want us back? I do not know too…
Do we have to change to continue? That is for sure, we are all doing it with the pandemic …

I have been on Fiverr for more than 5 years, I am really worried because from the “BUG of GIG views” I have not received any messages or orders.
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?

reply_text:
My reply was meant to d_designer44, personally I really do not notice any major changes in the past 2 years, everything is going naturally, business is ok, I managed to become Pro Certified and Top rated in the passt month, so for me it is all normal.
I think people do not realize that there are seasons in most areas of work, for me July and August are usually the strongest months followed by December / January. last year I made 40k € in total, but July and august alone were like 14k…
So you can not really tell how business is going unless you compare year-over-year (YOY )

thread_name: Gig Video Preview/Thumbnail problem. Pic appears Narrowed or Squished. Inconsistent across all Gigs
thread_text:
Why only in the last few months have my gig’s video thumbnail/picture, that people see when they search for gigs, display differently than what is actually part of my video. Every time I “Set As Preview” the thumbnail appears narrowed. Or vice versa thumbnail looks normal and when viewing gig the pic is narrow.



See attachments. One is what what I save and what it should look like, and the other is what it looks like after Fiverr updates it. It’s narrowed, squished, compressed, whatever you want to call it, and it just looks wrong.



Please fix or tell me what I’m doing wrong.
reply_text: N/A

It would not be logical to have an alert sound for every request, it would be annoying and over-bearing.
